Yes. exactly.
I've been update eclipse by eclipse update manager.
Should I reinstall eclipse ?

got installed properly.

Subject: 
             Problems with Update Manger
        Date: 
             Mon, 10 Jun 2002 05:45:05 +0000 (UTC)
        From: 
             froses@menta.net (Francesc Ros?s)
 Organization: 
             http://www.eclipse.org
  Newsgroups: 
             eclipse.tools




Hello,

  Sorry, I continue with Update Manager problems. Yesterday I was unable 
to complet the update (may be Internet problems) and Eclipse don't start 
if I use my workspace. If I use a clean workspace, no problem. I reinstall 
F2 and finally I can open Eclipse with my workspace.

  This morning, I do a new attempt to upgrade Eclipse. No problems with 
Internet and the Upgrade Manager seems to work fine. A dialog appears 
suggesting me to restart Eclipse. OK. And nothing... I click the Eclipse
icon 
pointing my workspace but an error dialog appears: "Problems during
startup. 
Check the ".log" file in the ".metadata" directory of your workspace.". 
However, if I start Eclipse pointing to a clean workspace, no problem.

  I use a proxy to communicate, but i thing this is not the problem.

  The contents of my .log file is:
-------------------------- cut here ----------------------------
!SESSION
----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 jun 10, 2002 07:44:34.437
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK

-------------------------- cut here ----------------------------

  Any idea? Thanks in advance,

    Francesc
  ... 14 more

We fixed numerous issue btween 2.0.0 and 2.0.2 about the startup.
Unable to reproduce this scenario
Please reopen if this still occurs with full description.

traces.message: Application not found: > > org.eclipse.ui.workbench. > >  at > > org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.jav > > a:737) > >

causedBy.message: The platform metadata area is already in use by another platform instance, or there was a failure in deleting the old lock file.  If no other platform instances are running, delete the lock file (C:\Aplic\eclipse\workspace\.metadata\.lock) and try starting the platform again.
